body: Hi! Take the last two, as [done](https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/master/demo.py#L70) during inference.

I understand your mean, I am asking the question at deepstream forum. Because I don't know how to correctly change program.

[https://forums.developer.nvidia.com/t/support-the-questions-of-lightweight-human-pose-estimation/173417](https://forums.developer.nvidia.com/t/support-the-questions-of-lightweight-human-pose-estimation/173417)

You see, channels number of outputs is different in DeepStream SDK and OpenPose. So, I believe you should adjust the code accordingly. My best guess, is that you can try to replace [topology](https://github.com/NVIDIA-AI-IOT/deepstream_pose_estimation/blob/master/post_process.cpp#L34) vector with this one (and recompile):
```
static Vec2D<int> topology{
    {12, 13, 1, 2},
    {20, 21, 1, 5},
    {14, 15, 2, 3},
    {16, 17, 3, 4},
    {22, 23, 5, 6},
    {24, 25, 6, 7},
    {0, 1, 1, 8},
    {2, 3, 8, 9},
    {4, 5, 9, 10},
    {6, 7, 1, 11},
    {8, 9, 11, 12},
    {10, 11, 12, 13},
    {28, 29, 1, 0},
    {30, 31, 0, 14},
    {34, 35, 14, 16},
    {32, 33, 0, 15},
    {36, 37, 15, 17},
    {18, 19, 2, 16},
    {26, 27, 5, 17}};
```

Although after I had changed topology, it's still some unusual.

Because topology is different location.
So, it's reason that some of the circles still display top on the windows?

The following image is DeepStream SDK topology image. 

![123](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9107549/112925828-140b7c00-9145-11eb-9852-d66a4b5a66db.png)

============================================================
Is it the topology image of lightweight-human-pose-estimation?
![111](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9107549/112727651-735b6780-8f5e-11eb-8ec9-eae70691f10d.png)

I believe DeepStream uses the same keypoints (it number is also 18 in their topology), but more pafs (21 vs 19, the new one is between eyes and hips). So looks like changing the topology to the above one may help. Can you please post your experience of integration this model to DeepStream app? It might help to others. Or just post the current visualizations before/after changing the topology, may be it is something obvious.

I fixed the following two parts of deepstream program about pose estimation. That could detect keypoints, but that's not complete. That still needs to improve it, because many keypoints still display top on the window.

std::tuple<Vec2D, Vec3D>
parse_objects_from_tensor_meta(NvDsInferTensorMeta *tensor_meta)
{
void *cmap_data = tensor_meta->out_buf_ptrs_host[2];
NvDsInferDims &cmap_dims = tensor_meta->output_layers_info[2].inferDims;
void *paf_data = tensor_meta->out_buf_ptrs_host[3];
NvDsInferDims &paf_dims = tensor_meta->output_layers_info[3].inferDims;


static Vec2D<int> topology{
    {0, 1, 1, 8},
    {2, 3, 8, 9},
    {4, 5, 9, 10},
    {6, 7, 1, 11},
    {8, 9, 11, 12},
    {10, 11, 12, 13},
    {12, 13, 1, 2},
    {14, 15, 2, 3},
    {16, 17, 3, 4},
    {18, 19, 2, 16},
    {20, 21, 1, 5},
    {22, 23, 5, 6},
    {24, 25, 6, 7},
    {26, 27, 5, 17},
    {28, 29, 1, 0},
    {30, 31, 0, 14},
    {32, 33, 0, 15},
    {34, 35, 14, 16},
    {36, 37, 15, 17}};

==================================================================================================

I don't tried it yet, but I think model maybe needs to change input to (1,3,256,256). I mean that before training model, crop image size to (256,256). 

===================================================================================================

https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/57db93e3b7254acaa0f03bb67950738ff7d7b1a6/datasets/coco.py#L64
Because this place, maybe must fix some details. I don't sure.

[deepstream_pose_estimation_config.txt](https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/files/6217705/deepstream_pose_estimation_config.txt)
[property]
net-scale-factor=0.0174292
offsets=123.675;116.28;103.53

This is my pose estimation property config. Maybe net-scale-factor and offsets must adjust, I saw the following link, I didn't understand how to adjust.
[https://docs.nvidia.com/metropolis/deepstream/dev-guide/text/DS_plugin_gst-nvinfer.html](https://docs.nvidia.com/metropolis/deepstream/dev-guide/text/DS_plugin_gst-nvinfer.html)

Set `net-scale-factor=0.00390625` (1/256),  `offsets=128;128;128` and `model-color-format=1`. You can change network input size to (1,3,256,256) during conversion to onnx [here](https://github.com/Daniil-Osokin/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/blob/master/scripts/convert_to_onnx.py#L10).

Line will be displayed if both keypoints in part are visible, check [here](https://github.com/NVIDIA-AI-IOT/deepstream_pose_estimation/blob/master/deepstream_pose_estimation_app.cpp#L118). You see, all keypoints are on their places. So I believe the issue is in the grouping code. Check these [functions](https://github.com/NVIDIA-AI-IOT/deepstream_pose_estimation/blob/master/deepstream_pose_estimation_app.cpp#L71-L73) to see why keypoints were not grouped into single skeleton instance.

I tried many kinds of topology or changed topology, it still has some circles on the windows top. Maybe these circles affect drawing lines.

I also changed many kinds of input size, but situation is the same. I don't understand how to improve that. 

static Vec2D<int> topology{

    {24, 25, 15, 17},
    {26, 27, 14, 16},
    {28, 29, 17, 5},
    {30, 31, 16, 2},
    {32, 33, 1, 0},
    {34, 35, 1, 5},
    {36, 37, 1, 2},
    {38, 39, 1, 11},
    {40, 41, 1, 8}};
It is better to use the topology I have provided. Try to debug to dig into the issue, as suggested above.
I understand, I try it again.
